ground_truth: The role of processes and management systems in Tesla's quality assurance program is to ensure that the company's quality expectations are met. Tesla has stringent expectations for suppliers and conducts on-site audits to stress the importance of the program. They also implemented an auditor training program and incorporate upstream supplier audits into their CSR audit program. These processes and systems help maintain and promote best practices throughout the supply chain.

Our Batteries are Designed for Our Batteries are Designed for 200K+ Miles of Driving 200K+ Miles of Driving

Vehicle battery production can result in over six metric tons of GHG emissions, so it's important that the battery lasts as long as the vehicle. Which is why we often get asked: Will I need to replace my battery at some point in the future? The answer is no. Since we've been selling EVs for over a decade, we have a reliable data set that shows us battery degradation over time. We estimate that a vehicle gets scrapped after approximately 200,000 miles of usage in the U.S. and roughly 150,000 miles in Europe. Even after 200,000 miles of usage, our batteries in Model 3 and Model Y lose just 15% of their capacity on average, while batteries in Model S and Model X lose just 12% of their capacity on average.

Product & Safety

Using new data to improve Using New Data to Improve pre-crash safety Pre-Crash Safety

We can learn from any crash We can learn from any crash

Whether simulated or real, we can learn from any crash to help optimize the protection of occupants and reduce the likelihood of injury. This fundamental philosophy one of the reasons our vehicles perform at industry leading levels in regulatory and consumer crash tests globally. Because our vehicles are connected we can further leverage this philosophy by deploying new safety capabilities and improvements over-the-air as a software update.

is

to Tesla,

Injury Studies Injury Studies

We leverage our ever-growing data set to help ensure occupants receive the best possible restraints (such as seat belts and airbags) for the impact they are involved in and design innovative restraint systems. Our safety analysis engineers evaluate simulation studies to enhance our understanding of the complex impacts that occur in the field. The pace with which we can conduct these studies has accelerated by automating our data pipelines and leveraging machine learning to analyze large data sets. As the capability of driver assistance advances, the nature of the crash exposure to our fleet will change.

Moving to Tesla Vision increases performance Moving to Tesla Vision increases performance

In 2021, we removed radar from our sensor suite. This improved safety while simultaneously simplifying engineering by removing a noisy signal. Model 3 scored better in both pedestrian (including nighttime tests) and urban crash avoidance scenarios under the Euro NCAP protocols with Tesla Vision only.

Product & Safety

Tesla pioneered the concept of vehicles that improve and become more capable over time by ensuring that every Tesla vehicle made since 2012 can accept over-the-air software updates. These updates have introduced new features and functionality smarter, safer and more enjoyable to drive. We have also used the over-the-air system to ensure that our vehicles are not only as secure as possible when they are delivered, but that they continue to stay as secure as their lifetime. possible throughout

that have made our vehicles

Furthermore, 99% of "recalls" of Tesla vehicles in 2023 were handled via over-the-air software updates-allowing our customers to skip a visit to our Service Centers, maximizing convenience and saving time.

ground_truth: OTA updates improve Tesla vehicles in terms of safety and functionality by introducing new features and functionality that make the vehicles smarter, safer, and more enjoyable to drive. These updates also ensure that the vehicles stay as secure as possible throughout their lifetime. Additionally, OTA updates allow for low-touch continuous improvement, eliminating the need for customers to visit service centers for recalls and maximizing convenience and saving time.

question: What measures does Tesla have in place to ensure data control and security for individuals?
contexts:
[" put individuals in control by giving them clear and transparent ways to access, review, manage and delete their data.

We safeguard personal data We safeguard personal data

We implement rigorous controls and standards designed to protect the security, confidentiality and integrity of Tesla's data environment.

14 14

Impact Report 2023 Impact Report 2023

Governance

Privacy From Day One Privacy From Day One

Tesla's Privacy Principles and commitments are illustrated throughout all our products. For Tesla vehicles, customers' personal data is protected from the moment they take delivery, ensuring that by default the vehicle data generated when driving is not associated with their account or vehicle identification number. We put customers in the driver's seat when it comes to data sharing by providing a dedicated in-vehicle menu to adjust preferences at any time. Additionally, energy products are designed to protect customer privacy. We aim to collect as little personal data as is required to provide an engaging in-app energy experience. To maximize transparency, Tesla has developed a seamless way for customers to download and access their energy and vehicle data at any time directly from the Tesla app.

15 15

Impact Report 2023 Impact Report 2023

Governance

Engaging the Security Engaging the Security Community Community

We are also focused on ensuring that our vehicles are the most secure on the road. Our team of world-class engineers continuously they are always as secure as possible. And while some of the best security engineers work at Tesla, we believe that in order to design and build inherently secure systems, we must work closely with the security research community and learn from their collective expertise and diversity of thought.

improve our systems to ensure

16 16

Impact Report 2023 Impact Report 2023

Governance

Embedding Security and Privacy Embedding Security and Privacy

To uphold rigorous standards regarding the security, confidentiality and integrity of customer and employee data, Tesla maintains a global privacy program as well as an information security program {based on the industry recognized ISO 27001 framework), which includes written policies, processes and standards designed to protect and secure Tesla's data environment.

Global Privacy Program Global Privacy Program

Guides product development and business practices across Tesla to ensure regulatory compliance by maintaining effective and standardized controls across vehicle and energy products as well as insurance and financial services

Tesla maintains a current 1S0/IEC 27001 certification that sets user security standards, for which we undergo yearly audits. We evaluate the health and effectiveness of our information security and privacy program through ongoing assessments, monitoring and testing.

Product Security Product Security

A comprehensive approach to managing product vulnerabilities building defense in depth protections, security policies, monitoring, partnering with external security researchers and financially rewarding people outside the company who find and report vulnerabilities

including conducting design and code reviews,

testing, maintaining

Third-Party Risk Management Third-Party Risk Management

Identify, mitigate and monitor risks from third parties such as vendors, suppliers and other business partners, including those in our supply chain who may require certain Tesla data to conduct operations

Infrastructure Security Infrastructure Security

Prevention, detection and response to IT outages, security incidents or acts of nature to provide availability of underlying critical services and continuity of operations

ground_truth: Tesla has implemented rigorous controls and standards to protect the security, confidentiality, and integrity of its data environment. They give individuals clear and transparent ways to access, review, manage, and delete their data. Tesla's Privacy Principles and commitments are illustrated throughout all their products, ensuring that customers' personal data is protected from the moment they take delivery of a vehicle. Tesla also provides a dedicated in-vehicle menu for customers to adjust their data sharing preferences. Additionally, Tesla collects as little personal data as required for an engaging energy experience and allows customers to download and access their energy and vehicle data directly from the Tesla app. Tesla maintains a global privacy program and an information security program based on the ISO 27001 framework, which includes written policies, processes, and standards. They also conduct yearly audits and ongoing assessments to evaluate the effectiveness of their information security and privacy program. Tesla has a comprehensive approach to managing product vulnerabilities, including conducting design and code reviews, testing, and partnering with external security researchers. They also identify, mitigate, and monitor risks from third parties such as vendors and suppliers. Furthermore, Tesla ensures infrastructure security to provide availability of critical services and continuity of operations.

ground_truth: Suppliers have taken several steps to address human rights policies in the mining industry. These steps include establishing robust human rights policies and supplier codes of conduct, investing in improving tailings storage facilities to meet international standards, evaluating dewatering tailings storage to reduce water withdrawals, and conducting audits against Tesla-preferred international standards covering environmental and social risks. Additionally, one supplier has built a pipeline for full traceability of nickel ore directly from a mine to a smelter. These actions demonstrate the commitment of suppliers to promote safer mine waste practices and ensure traceability in the mining industry.

Supplier Selection Guidelines Supplier Selection Guidelines

In 2023, we added responsible sourcing due diligence to Tesla's internal Global Procurement Policy supplier selection guidelines to include social and environmental criteria in sourcing decisions before awarding business to any supplier, including but not limited to, CSR audit scores, SAQ results, complaints submitted via Tesla's Integrity Line and greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions.

132 132

Impact Report 2023 Impact Report 2023

Supply Chain

Supplier Self-Assessment Supplier Self-Assessment Questionnaire (SAQ) Questionnaire (SAQ)

The Supplier Self-Assessment Questionnaire (SAQ) pushes Tesla sourcing efforts beyond generalized risk associated with certain commodities and countries by requiring each unique location providing production parts, materials or services to Tesla to submit a response to the SAQ. Suppliers affirm that they have policies, processes and controls at the manufacturing site level consistent with all Supplier Code of Conduct topic areas: labor, health and safety, environment, ethics and supply chain responsibility. This systematic process to identify risk at scale based on actual practices enables Tesla teams to proactively prioritize more extensive due diligence for high-risk suppliers based on the extent of potential impact on workers' health, safety or fundamental human rights and number of workers/ employees impacted at the supplier site.

In 2023, we scaled our SAQ program from pilots to full launch reaching nearly 1,000 supplier sites and will continue our outreach in 2024. Follow-up with suppliers includes communication of risks identified and best practices along with development of supplier specific improvement plans, such as guidance on how to close policy gaps and building supply chain mapping capabilities. Additionally, we will communicate results to supply chain leadership and buyers.

ground_truth: Tesla's CSR audit program benefits from incorporating upstream supplier audits by recognizing that responsibility does not stop at tier 1 suppliers and that best practices should be promoted throughout the supply chain. This alignment with Tesla's supplier selection guidelines ensures that social and environmental criteria are considered in sourcing decisions, including CSR audit scores, SAQ results, complaints submitted via Tesla's Integrity Line, and greenhouse gas emissions.

Outcome Outcome

Found no breach of contract and worked with the partner to improve processes

Encouraged removal of certain actors from Tesla's upstream supply chain

Engaged Tier 1 supplier with audit programs

In addition to promoting supply chain use of the Tesla Integrity Line, as part of our CSR Audit Program, we assess suppliers' conformance with our Supplier Code of Conduct expectation to maintain a grievance mechanism of their own. This is assessed through site observation, records review and interviews of management and workers. In 2023, 96% of supplier facilities demonstrated conformance with this expectation.*

We also act on concerns raised through avenues such as via NGOs, investors, customers and employees, among others. For continual improvement we are exploring opportunities Integrity Line. In the future, we seek to incorporate from affected-stakeholders process, including representatives and human rights defenders with the goal to ensure that our mechanism is responsive to the needs of affected stakeholders.

Sourcing for Social Impact Sourcing for Social Impact

We invest in communities where we operate-not our direct operations but in our supply chain as well to ensure that investments in a sustainable future are equitable. Sourcing for Social Impact programs promote purchasing policies, programs and processes that contribute suppliers operate. We operate and source from all types of communities and want to make sure that everyone has in the access to economic development opportunities sustainable energy future.

just in

to socio-economic benefits where Tesla

Programs Programs

Specific programs promote inclusive sourcing from suppliers that traditionally would not have access to procurement opportunities.

We established a Gigafactory Texas Historically Underutilized Business (HUB) program in 2020 as part of our Economic Agreement with Travis County with a focus on identifying suppliers in construction materials and services to support ongoing factory expansion.

More broadly, the purpose of the agreement is to stimulate and encourage business and commercial activity in Travis County as Tesla invests in new construction of Gigafactory Texas operating facilities. Since 2020, Tesla has spent over $100 million with qualified HUB program suppliers, supporting women-owned businesses in Texas.

External Stakeholder Engagement External Stakeholder Engagement

Held face-to-face meetings with six different Austin area minority supplier and small business chambers of learning sessions on commerce/councils their capabilities and how to leverage them to increase HUB supplier participation.

for in-depth

Became a corporate member of the Southwest Minority Supplier Development Council (SMSDC). SMSDC is a multi-stakeholder organization headquartered in Austin focused on minority-owned business (M BE) advocacy, development, certification and connection. Joining SMSDC as a corporate member supports ongoing efforts to identify and increase spend with HUB suppliers.

Moreover, ongoing corporate member training services will further strengthen Tesla's Sourcing for Social Impact program to be in alignment with best practices while building relationships with Austin area stakeholders.

Internal Stakeholder Engagement Internal Stakeholder Engagement

Corporate Social Corporate Social Responsibility Audits Responsibility Audits

In 2023, our Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) audit program continued to be a key component of how we identify and mitigate risks at our suppliers' sites. It provides us with the ability to have an independent assessment of our direct supplier's performance to our Supplier Code of Conduct. Our requirement of Corrective identified during the Action Plans for non-conformances audit also means we are contributing to tangible improvements facilities, regardless of being employees or contract workers,"]
ground_truth: Tesla engaged with external stakeholders in their supply chain management by holding face-to-face meetings with minority supplier and small business chambers, providing learning sessions on their capabilities and how to leverage them to increase supplier participation. They also became a corporate member of the Southwest Minority Supplier Development Council (SMSDC) to support efforts in identifying and increasing spend with historically underutilized business (HUB) suppliers. Additionally, Tesla provided ongoing training services to strengthen their Sourcing for Social Impact program and build relationships with stakeholders.
